00084 class FunctionParameterValueBase {
00085     public:
00086         /* I have to declare the getters and setters for every type of
00087            derived classes that will be instantiated. PITA.
00088            what's worse, i have to define no-ops as default implementation,
00089            because otherwise the templated derived class would remain
00090            abstract. that totally breaks type-safety during compilation.      */
00093         virtual void setValue(const double &) { }       
00094         virtual void setValue(const unsigned &) { }     
00095         virtual void setValue(const int &) { }          
00096         virtual void setValue(const std::string &) { }  
00097         
00098         virtual void setValue(const char *) = 0;
00099 
00100         virtual operator double() = 0;                  
00101         virtual operator unsigned() = 0;                
00102         virtual operator int() = 0;                     
00103         virtual operator std::string() = 0;             
00104 };
00105 
00107 
00118 template <typename T> class FunctionParameterValue:
00119         public FunctionParameterValueBase {
00120     public:
00121         FunctionParameterValue<T>(const T &_value): value(_value) { }
00122 
00123 //      getValue() is never used. But it seems to make sense to declare it...
00124 //      virtual const T &getValue() const { return value; }
00125         virtual void setValue(const T &_value) {
00126             value = _value;
00127         }
00129         virtual void setValue(const char *);
00130 
00136         virtual operator double() { return 0.; }
00137         virtual operator unsigned() { return 0; }
00138         virtual operator int() { return 0; }
00139         virtual operator std::string() { return ""; }
00140 
00141     private:
00142         T value;
00143 };
00144 
00146 
00165 class FunctionParameter {
00166     public:
00167         FunctionParameter(const std::string &_name,
00168                           const std::string &_description = ""):
00169             pImpl(new Impl(_name, _description)) {}
00170         ~FunctionParameter() { delete pImpl; }
00171 
00173         operator double() {
00174             return double(*(pImpl->value));
00175         }
00177         operator unsigned() { return (unsigned)(*(pImpl->value));}
00179         operator int() { return (int)(*(pImpl->value));}
00181         operator std::string() { return (std::string)(*(pImpl->value));}
00182 
00184         const std::string &getName() const { return pImpl->name; }
00186         void setName(const std::string &_name) { pImpl->name = _name; }
00188         const std::string &getDescription() const { return pImpl->description; }
00190         void setDescription(const std::string &_description) {
00191             pImpl->description = _description;
00192         }
00193 
00195 
00199         template<typename T> void setValue(FunctionParameterValue<T> *_value) {
00200             pImpl->value.reset(_value);
00201         }
00202 
00204         void setValue(std::string _value) {
00205             pImpl->value->setValue(_value.c_str());
00206         }
00207 
00209 
00213         template<typename T> void setDefaultValue(
00214                 FunctionParameterValue<T> *_defaultValue) {
00215             pImpl->defaultValue.reset(_defaultValue);
00216         }
00217 
00218     private:
00219         //  these accessors are never used, but i like to keep them around
00220 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value() {
00221 //             return pImpl->value;
00222 //         }
00223 //         const std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value() const {
00224 //             return pImpl->value;
00225 //         }
00226 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue() {
00227 //             return pImpl->defaultValue;
00228 //         }
00229 //         std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue() const {
00230 //             return pImpl->defaultValue;
00231 //         }
00232 
00234         struct Impl {
00235             Impl(const std::string &_name,
00236                           const std::string &_description = ""):
00237                     name(_name), description(_description), value(0),
00238                     defaultValue(0) {}
00239             ~Impl() { }
00240             std::string name;
00241             std::string description;
00242             std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> value;
00243             std::auto_ptr<FunctionParameterValueBase> defaultValue;
00244         };
00245         Impl *pImpl;
00246 };
00247 
00249 
00251 class ParameterFac {
00252     public:
00254         template <typename T>
00255                 FunctionParameter *createParameterWithValue(
00256                     const std::string &_name, const T &_value) {
00257             FunctionParameter *tmp = new FunctionParameter(_name);
00258             tmp->setValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_value));
00259 
00260             return tmp;
00261         }
00262 
00264         template <typename T>
00265                 FunctionParameter *createParameterWithDefault(
00266                     const std::string &_name, const T &_default,
00267                     const std::string &_description = "") {
00268             FunctionParameter *tmp = new FunctionParameter(_name, _description);
00269             tmp->setDefaultValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_default));
00270             tmp->setValue(new FunctionParameterValue<T>(_default));
00271 
00272             return tmp;
00273         }
00274 };

00280 typedef Loki::SingletonHolder<ParameterFac> ParameterFactory;
